resources.string: Welcome to the Galilee - one of the most beautiful regions of Israel. Situated in the north of the country, it is characterized by its beautiful lush landscape with agriculture, amazing natural landforms, historic sites, and quaint rural villages. Galilee is a popular destination for domestic and foreign tourists who enjoy its scenic, recreational, and gastronomic offerings. The Galilee attracts many Christian pilgrims, as many of the miracles of Jesus occurred, according to the New Testament, on the shores of the Sea of Galilee. In addition, numerous sites of biblical importance are located in the Galilee, such as Megiddo, Jezreel Valley, Mount Tabor, Hatsor and more.

Kfar Kedem creates a holistic experience using all your senses, involving you in the actual production of household staples such as milk, wool, and bread, and connecting these tangible experiences with the values and spirit of the ages from the time of the Bible.
Kfar Blum Kayaks - rafting experience and attraction center

Come join us on a magical river adventure, comfortably rafting by and under riverside foliage, down the beautifully clear Hatzbani stream, later merging with the Banias stream to create the Jordan River, on which our rafting adventure continues.
Karmiel Quarry Galilee Park - Beautiful nature, sculptures and installations
Karmiel Quarry Galilee Park - A beautiful park with interesting features such as a waterfall, rose garden, amphitheatre, a musical site with bird songs, many sculptures and artworks.
Monkey Forest - An Educational Animal Sanctuary
Monkey Forest -an educational animal sanctuary inside a forest. Animals, shade of the oak trees, fountains, quiet meditation spots.
Manara Cliff - Xtreme park with chairlift and alpine slide

Manara Cliff is Israel\'s leading adventure park, a home for lovers of extreme sports, nature and hiking. The beauty of the Upper Galilee and Naphtali Ridge, spread out in all its glory and strength, is yours to enjoy from every attraction at Manara Cliff, creating a powerful emotional experience.
The Agamon Hula Ornithology and Nature Park

The Agamon Hula - is a highly significant and prominent center for eco-tourism in Israel and throughout the world, and a model for cooperation between nature, tourism and agriculture. Thousands of migrating birds remain here during the winter, and other choose to nest here during the spring and summer.
Boat ride on the Sea of Galilee
The Ein Gev harbor - picturesque lakeside promenade overlooking the Sea of Galilee in Israel and the Golan Height Activities on the water – cruises, Galilee tours, fishing and more.
Tabgha ("spring of seven") - a place of the miracle of the multiplication of the loaves and fishes (Mark 6:30-46) and the fourth resurrection appearance of Jesus(John 21:1-24) after his Crucifixion.

The Church of the Annunciation is a church in Nazareth. It was established over the site where the Catholic tradition holds to be the house of Virgin Mary, and where angel Gabriel appeared to her and announced that she would conceive and bear the Son of God, Jesus – an event known as the Annunciation.

Church of Transfiguration - Mountaintop Catholic church built on 4th century foundations, known for its views and mosaics. The site is thick with ruins of Christian occupation in the Byzantine and Crusader periods (5th-6th centuries and 12th-13th centuries respectively).
Benny\'s Nature - Vegan Restaurant - "Under the shadow of a fig tree"
Pizza Niro - vegan and gluten free choices
Dag al ha Dan - River Fish Restaurant

The " Dag al haDan" restaurant is a pleasant and quiet place in nature. The clean and clear air and the pastoral tranquility combine with the sound of the stream. There is a rich selection of fresh fish grown right here in the fish ponds adjacent to the restaurant.
Dag al ha Dan, Kibbuts Dan

On the rural country road, with pine hills, tobacco fields and Galilean landscape spread just outside the window Aluma restaurant has a table ready for you. The restaurant serves Galilean cuisine composed of ethnic ingredients with an added European touch,all made into carefully composed dishes with flavors to remember.
Aluma Bistro, Alon St 16, Ma\'alot Tarshiha

Lotem Organic Winery located at the beautiful view overlooking all Galilee. The winery became a combination of uncompromising quality of winemaking, quality organic grape vineyard near Kibbutz Tzivon Meron and unique energetic processes such as music playback on any production line and obsolescence.
The pomegranates used at the Rimon Winery thrive in the basalt-rich soil that is typical of this special region, and give this wine its special characteristic flavor and color.

The Netofa Winery offers elegant, old-world-type fine wines exemplified by smooth body and complex bouquets and flavors. The Netofa Winery\'s vineyards, planted on the soil of Lower Galilee, feature an array of varieties, whose compatibility with the terroir maximizes the qualities and characteristics of the grapes.

The Abouhav Winery is nestled among the quaint Old City lanes of Safed, in an historic 16th century structure. It is a boutique winery, producing about 25,000 bottles a year.Most bottles are exported to private clients around the world or sold at the winery.The wine is made in an old traditional unique method.

Yiftah’el winery in Alon Hagalil is owned by a third generation of farmers. The vineyards are spread over the southern slopes of the Zippori river. On its reach and red limestone soil are grown five varieties of wine grapes: Cabernet sauvignon, Merlot, Shiraz, Sangiovese and Petit syrah.

The Ramot Naftaly winery is located in Kedesh Valley, a unique area where quality wine grapes have grown since ancient times. The winemaker, Yitzhak Cohen, dreamt of founding a small, high-quality, family-run winery. Since he began making his own wine in 2003, the winery has received acclaim and many awards.
Ramot Naftaly Winery, Moshav Ramot Naftaly

Nestled in the heart of the Galilee, Dalton Winery is a gem that derives its excellence from the skills of its people and the natural gifts of its surroundings. Established in 1995 by father and son Mat and Alex Haruni, the two identified the potential of the Upper Galilee, envisioning it as a premium wine producing region.
